original-title: Gender pay gap in unadjusted form in % - NACE Rev. 2 (structure of earnings survey methodology) [earn_gr_gpgr2]
short indicator description german: Geschlechtsspezifischer Lohnunterschied anhand des durchschnittlichen Stundenlohn einer weiblichen Mitarbeiterin zum durschnittlichen Stundenlohn eines männlichen Mitarbeiters.
short indicator description english: Gender pay gap between hourly pay of male and female employees in percentage
long indicator description german: The unadjusted Gender Pay Gap (GPG) represents the difference between average gross hourly earnings of male paid employees and of female paid employees as a percentage of average gross hourly earnings of male paid employees. The population consists of all paid employees in enterprises with 10 employees or more in NACE Rev. 2 aggregate B to S (excluding O). The GPG indicator is calculated within the framework of the data collected according to the methodology of the Structure of Earnings Survey.(Source: Eurostat)
long indicator description english: The unadjusted Gender Pay Gap (GPG) represents the difference between average gross hourly earnings of male paid employees and of female paid employees as a percentage of average gross hourly earnings of male paid employees. The population consists of all paid employees in enterprises with 10 employees or more in NACE Rev. 2 aggregate B to S (excluding O). The GPG indicator is calculated within the framework of the data collected according to the methodology of the Structure of Earnings Survey. (Source: Eurostat)
explanation of target: Best performers erreichen Werte um 3 % Lohndifferenz. Ab 2% wird eine sehr gute Bewertung gegeben.
source note: The GPG indicator is calculated within the framework of the data collected according to the methodology of the Structure of Earnings Survey
scoring: 0-10% = niedriger Lohnunterschied = 1 = sehr gut, 11-17,5% = mäßiger Lohnunerschied = 3 = mittel, >18% = hoher Lohnunterschied = 5 = sehr schlecht
0-10% = low gender pay gap = 1 = very good, 11-17,5% = moderate gender pay gap = 3 = satisfactory, >18% = high gender pay gap = 5 = very bad
